Back to Robert Schumann

Robert Schumann

Sechs Konzert-Etüden nach Capricen von Paganini, op. 10

1833

[IMSLP]

Total duration: 29' 30"

  • 1. A-flat major
  • 2. G minor
  • 3. G minor
  • 4. C minor
  • 5. B minor
  • 6. E minor

The studies are arrangements of extracts from Nicolò Paganini’s twenty-four caprices for solo violin (op. 1); another six arrangements are the Studien nach Capricen von Paganini (op. 3). Schumann also later wrote piano accompaniments to the original twenty-four caprices (Anh. O8).

Recommended editions

  • Gesamtausgabe (Schott) · III/1/2 · RSA 1017 · ed. Michael Beiche
  • Henle · HN 922 · Sämtliche Klavierwerke / Band II · ed. Ernst Herttrich
  • Henle · HN 923 · Sämtliche Klavierwerke / Band II · ed. Ernst Herttrich
  • Henle · HN 614 · ed. Ernst Herttrich

1. A-flat major

This is an arrangement of the twelfth caprice.

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

2. G minor

This is an arrangement of the sixth caprice.

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 3.5

3. G minor

This is an arrangement of the tenth caprice.

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 5

4. C minor

This is an arrangement of the fourth caprice.

Duration: 10'

Difficulty: 4.5

5. B minor

This is an arrangement of the second caprice.

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 5

6. E minor

This is an arrangement of the third caprice.

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 5
